abstract: Hans-Jörg Butt (German pronunciation: [hans ˈjœɐ̯k ˈbʊt]; born 28 May 1974) is a German retired footballer who played as a goalkeeper. Known for taking penalty kicks, he scored 26 goals in the Bundesliga. He played for Hamburger SV, Bayer Leverkusen and Bayern Munich in his country, having arrived at Munich already aged 34.During his career, Butt scored three times from the penalty spot against Juventus with three different clubs. He represented Germany in two World Cups and Euro 2000.
